thread.title: Live score: India v Australia, 3rd Test, Day 3
thread.title_full: Live score: India v Australia, 3rd Test, Day 3

title: Live score: India v Australia, 3rd Test, Day 3
text: S O'Keefe to Pujara, No run. 41.1 OVERS India: 121/1 S O'Keefe to Pujara, No run. Steve O'Keefe will continue. 40.6 OVERS India: 121/1 J Hazlewood to Vijay, Stays low! Fuller delivery, slightly outside off, Vijay looks to defend but the ball hardly bounces and Wade collects it on one bounce. 40.5 OVERS India: 121/1 J Hazlewood to Vijay, Angles in a fuller delivery, Vijay is rock solid in defense. 40.4 OVERS India: 121/1 J Hazlewood to Vijay, Back of a length delivery, which swings back in, Vijay stands in his crease and blocks it with a straight face of the bat. 40.3 OVERS India: 121/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, First runs of the day. Good length delivery, sixth stump line, Pujara runs it down to third man for a single. 40.2 OVERS India: 120/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, On a length, which angles in, Pujara offers a front foot defense. 40.1 OVERS India: 120/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Starts Day 3 with a fuller ball, outside off, Pujara strides forward and defends it solidly. It's time to get going. The players are on the field. Murali Vijay and Cheteshwar Pujara walk out to the centre. News from the Indian dressing room is that VIRAT KOHLI IS PADDED UP. Really good news for the home fans. Steven Smith tosses the ball to Josh Hazlewood, who will kick off proceedings. Pitch report - The cracks have started to open and batting is going to get hard, opines Sunil Gavaskar. Jadeja was effective yesterday after bowling in the rough and Steve O'Keefe too can exploit that area of the pitch. Hello and welcome to the third day of the third Test between India and Australia. The hosts have got what they just would have wanted, a solid start. Though they would be disheartened to lose KL Rahul's wicket, the experienced pair of Murali Vijay and Cheteshwar Pujara is at the crease. The home side's aim would be to bat out the whole day as Umesh Yadav pointed out yesterday that each session averages almost 100. Steven Smith's side, on the other hand, will try to make early inroads to put pressure on the hosts. Can India build on the solid platform or will Australia swing the pendulum into their side? Stay with us to find out ...DAY 3, SESSION 1... Australia's bowling was decent on an unresponsive pitch. Pat Cummins was the standout bowler for them, as he bowled his heart out and impressed with his pace and smart variations. Their spinners, however, failed to leave any impact and the visiting team will be hoping that they turn things around tomorrow. India still trail by a big margin and will have to continue batting well to narrow the gap. It promises to be an exciting day 3. Do join us at 0930 local (0400 GMT) for all the action. Cheers! A good session for India! They scored 100 runs for the loss of one wicket and will be pretty pleased with their effort. After scoring a fluent half century, KL Rahul fell prey to Pat Cummins' short ball ploy. But after that, Murali Vijay and Cheteshwar Pujara joined forces and didn't allow any more opening to the Aussies. 39.6 OVERS India: 120/1 S O'Keefe to Vijay, Tossed up ball outside off, Murali leans forward and defends it with an angled bat. Stumps on day 2! 39.5 OVERS India: 120/1 S O'Keefe to Vijay, Probably an arm ball around off, Vijay keeps it out off the inner half of the bat to the leg side. 39.4 OVERS India: 120/1 S O'Keefe to Vijay, Strides forward to a full ball and drives it with the spin to covers. 39.3 OVERS India: 120/1 S O'Keefe to Vijay, Lunges to a full ball and defends it back watchfully. 39.2 OVERS India: 120/1 S O'Keefe to Vijay, Loopy and full on off, Vijay presses forward and defends it back. 39.1 OVERS India: 120/1 S O'Keefe to Vijay, Full flighted ball on off, driven back to the bowler. Steve O'Keefe to bowl the last over of the day. 38.6 OVERS India: 120/1 N Lyon to C Pujara, Flatter and shorter outside off, Pujara rocks back to cut but gets an outside edge towards first slip. Doesn't carry to Smith and ricochets off his right boot towards the right side of the short leg fielder. 38.5 OVERS India: 120/1 N Lyon to Vijay, Tossed up ball on off, pushed gently towards extra cover for a run. 38.4 OVERS India: 119/1 N Lyon to Vijay, Floated off spinner on middle, worked off the pads to mid-wicket. 38.3 OVERS India: 119/1 N Lyon to Vijay, Turns it off his pads to the leg side. 38.2 OVERS India: 119/1 Lyon to Vijay, Not out! Day light between bat and ball. Waste of a review by Australia. Loopy off spinner landing around leg, spinning in with some extra bounce, Vijay gets forward to defend but fails to middle it. It pops out off his pads, Handscomb catches it at short leg and they appeal. Nothing from the umpire and Smith takes the DRS after chatting with his players. The replays show that it was not a good call to opt for it. Appeal for a bat-pad! Not given by the umpire and Steven Smith takes the referral. 38.1 OVERS India: 119/1 N Lyon to Vijay, FOUR! Lovely shot! A floated full ball around off, Vijay wears his skates to shimmy down the track and caresses it through mid off for a boundary. 37.6 OVERS India: 115/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Back of a length ball on off, holding its line, Pujara drops his wrists and allows it through to the keeper. 37.5 OVERS India: 115/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, FOUR! The idea was right from the bowler but not the execution. He attempts to bowl a yorker but ends up slipping a low full toss on middle, Pujara picks it off his pads and flicks it neatly through mid-wicket for a boundary. 37.4 OVERS India: 111/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, A touch short and around middle and leg, Che gets across and fends it away towards short leg. 37.3 OVERS India: 111/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Lands it full and just outside off, Pujara is forced to play at it and he does well to keep it out with an angled bat. Playing for stumps now, it appears. 37.2 OVERS India: 111/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Fuller and straighter on middle, Pujara flicks it across the line but finds the wide mid on fielder. 37.1 OVERS India: 111/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Full and angling into the batsman, around off, Che draws forward and defends it solidly. 36.6 OVERS India: 111/1 N Lyon to Vijay, Quicker full ball wide outside off, Murali drives it off his front foot to covers. 36.5 OVERS India: 111/1 N Lyon to Pujara, Straighter in line, Pujara gets back and works it past FSL for a run. 36.4 OVERS India: 110/1 N Lyon to Pujara, Bowls it quicker through the air, full and on middle, 94 kph, Pujara defends it off his back foot. 36.3 OVERS India: 110/1 N Lyon to Vijay, Played to the mid-wicket region by the batsman. One run added to the total. 36.2 OVERS India: 109/1 N Lyon to Vijay, Gets forward to a full ball and blocks it safely. 36.1 OVERS India: 109/1 N Lyon to Vijay, Defended off the front foot by the batsman presenting the full face of the bat. 35.6 OVERS India: 109/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Lands it full and outside off, Pujara taps it down with an angled bat to cover-point. 35.5 OVERS India: 109/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Probes around the off stump with a fuller length, Che gets on the front foot and pushes it to covers. 35.4 OVERS India: 109/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Good length ball on off, Pujara dabs it down towards backward point. His partner wants the single but is sent back. 35.3 OVERS India: 109/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, A gentle length delivery in the channel outside off, Pujara makes an easy leave. 35.2 OVERS India: 109/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Pitches it fuller again, around off, Che gets forward and defends it off inner half of the bat to mid on. 35.1 OVERS India: 109/1 J Hazlewood to Pujara, Angles in a full ball on off, Pujara defends it off his front foot to mid off. Josh Hazlewood replaces Cummins in the attack. 34.6 OVERS India: 109/1 N Lyon to Vijay, The batsman has defended it by getting right behind the line of the delivery. 34.5 OVERS India: 109/1 N Lyon to Pujara, A bit short on middle, Che works it in the gap on the leg side a run.
